hydrogen.title: Hydrogen (H)
hydrogen.content: I have discovered a gas which I shall call 'Hydrogen'. It is lighter than air, but an escaped whiff of it made my torch flare alarmingly. I should use caution around open flames.

helium.title: Helium (He)
helium.content: This gas I shall call Helium. It is lighter than air, and almost completely inert.

lithium.title: Lithium (Li)
lithium.content: When I touched this metal with my bare hand, it burned me. Further testing showed that it has a rather violent reaction with water. I shall call it Lithium.

beryllium.title: Beryllium (Be)
beryllium.content: I've discovered a lightweight metal with excellent strength and thermal transfer properties. I'll call it Beryllium.

lighting.title: Lighting
lighting.content: It appears that adding certain elements to my tools allow them to light up dark areas when I am mining.

redstone.title: Redstone
redstone.content: I have found a way to activate my machines without the need for a lever - Redstone augmented tools can be used indefinitely for this purpose.

tnt.title: Explosive
tnt.content: I attempted to add explosive chemicals to my tool today, the results are... exciting.

sharp.title: Sharpness
sharp.content: I coated my tool with X and found it held an excellent edge.

flint.title: Flint
flint.content: Adding a flintlock to my tool allows me to activate some of the more volatile chemical augments more safely.

reinforced.title: Reinforced
reinforced.content: Augmenting tools with tough materials seems like a sensible way to increase their lifespan.

unstable.title: Unstable
unstable.content: Ack! I had a small misadventure today - it seems applying highly radioactive chemicals to a hand tool is a mistake.
